It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, cup-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, often in clusters at the ends of its slender stems. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
